content.webTitle: Baugur promotes UK chief to larger role

fields.headline: Baugur promotes UK chief to larger role
fields.bodyText: Baugur, the Icelandic company which owns huge swaths of the UK high street, has reorganised its management and promoted the executive who had been running the UK operations. Gunnar Sigurdsson will now be responsible for the group's retail operations in Iceland and other parts of the world, essentially Denmark and the UK. In five years Baugur has built up investments in the UK from Jane Norman and House of Fraser to Mappin & Webb and Iceland supermarkets. It also has a big stake in Mosaic, which owns womenswear shops Karen Millen and Oasis and stakes in Woolworths and Moss Bros.
